full_text: Daleepiets fal | ie eee 2024/KER/6312 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MRS. JUSTICE SOPHY THOMAS TUESDAY, THE 23? DAY OF JANUARY 2024 / 3RD MAGHA, 1945 CRL.MC NO. 80 OF 2024 CRIME NO.41/2023 OF VANITHA POLICE STATION, ALAPPUZHA, Alappuzha PETITIONER/ACCUSED: BASHIR.K AGED 50 YEARS S/O KUNJUMUHAMMED, VELIYATHUPARAMBU HOUSE, THRICHATTUKULAM P.O, PANAVALLY ,CHERTHALA, ALAPPUZHA DISTRICT,KERALA-, PIN 688581 BY ADV CHITHRA S.BABU RESPONDENTS/STATE AND DEFACTO COMPLAINANT: 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM., PIN - 682031 2 MAYA AGED 38 YEARS W/O. PETERSSON, HOUSENO.28, GIRINAGAR, KADAVANTHRA P.O, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT,KERALA, PIN 682020 SR.PP-SRI.RENJIT GEORGE THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COMB UP FOR ADMISSION ON 23.01.2024, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: a ieee 2024/KER/6312 CRL.MC NO.80 OF 2024 2 ORDER Dated this the 23" day of January , 2024 This Crl.M.C., under Section 482 of Cr.P.C., is filed by the sole accused in Crime No.41 of 2023 of Vanitha Police Station, Alappuzha, registered under Sections 420, 384, 506 and 509 of IPC, for quashing Annexure Al FIR. 2. The prosecution allegation is that the accused, with an intention to cheat the defacto complainant/2nd respondent, did not return the money borrowed from her while they were in a relationship. He uttered obscene words against her, when she asked for repayment of the money. 3. When the Crl.M.C. is taken up for consideration, learned counsel for the petitioner submitted that the matter stands settled between himself and the defacto complainant. The defacto complainant entered appearance through counsel, and submitted that the matter stands a [eae 2024/KER/6312 CRL.MC NO.80 OF 2024 settled. Annexure A2 is the affidavit filed by her, endorsing the settlement. Neither she has any intention to proceed with the prosecution nor any objection in quashing Annexure Al FIR in Crime No.41 of 2023. 4. On instructions, learned Public Prosecutor submitted that the matter is settled and he produced signed statement of the defacto complainant. In that statement also, she has stated that she is not intending to proceed with the prosecution, and she has no objection in quashing Annexure Al FIR in Crime No.41 of 2023. 5. Since the matter stands settled, no purpose would be served by continuing the prosecution against the petitioner. 6. In the light of the principles laid down by the Apex Court in Gian Singh v. State of Punjab and Another; [(2012) 10 SCC 303)], and State of Madhya Pradesh vy. Laxmi Narayan and Others; [(2019) 5 SCC 688], this Court is of the view that the proceedings against the petitioner can be quashed on the basis of settlement. Deere) a mes Tere 2024/KER/6312 CRL.MC NO.80 OF 2024 4 Moreover, the dispute is purely personal in nature and no public interest is involved in it. In the result, this Crl.MC is allowed, and Annexure Al FIR in Crime No.41 of 2023 of Vanitha Police Station, Alappuzha, stands quashed. Sd/- SOPHY THOMAS JUDGE SSK/23/01 ie sat Tere 2024/KER/6312 5 APPENDIX OF CRL.MC 80/2024 PETITIONER ANNEXURES Annexure-Al THE TRUE COPY OF THE FIRST INFORMATION REPORT IN CRIME NO 41 /2023 OF VANITHA POLICE STATION, ALAPPUZHA DISTRICT Annexure-A2 TRUE COPY OF AFFIDAVIT SWORN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT
